text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Kyle Pearson.
I work for Global Financial Services

under the Security Risk and
Compliance Organization.
So, as an Engagement Security Leader,

I get to help our customers
move their workloads securely
and work with our security consultants

to ensure that all the
work that we do as Amazon
is secure for our customers,
so our motto is "Secure from the Start."

The Amazon culture is built
around a day one concept.

And that is something that
really resonated with me,

the idea that everything is
new, everything is possible.
There's no no to new ideas.
It focuses on culture, focuses on equity
and focuses on inclusion,

which are principles that
I hold in high regard.

Inside AWS, there are
a lot of opportunities
outside of just technical areas.

For example, I'm part of
the Black Employee Network.
I, myself, as I looked at Amazon
across a technical landscape,
I was skeptical as well,
as to whether that was the company for me.

I can tell you, once you come
in, you absorb the culture.
There's a place for everybody.
I talk to so many people and I tell them,

they're like, "Well, I don't
know if that's a job for me."

And I was like, "Don't worry
about it. Come in and do it.
And then if you don't like it,
there's a million other things you can do
inside the company.
Don't think about taking it
that you're stuck there forever."

Honestly, I was kind of
shocked when I came in
of all the different options.
I was like, "Oh, you know what?
Soon as my daughter graduates college
I'm done with this technical stuff.
I'm gonna go do some HR and D&I,
and go do some stuff there."
(bright music)
